item.title: Four simple ways to integrate your data dictionary into your data cleaning process
item.description: In an earlier blog post I wrote about the importance of a data dictionary. In that post I argued that data dictionaries are one of the most important pieces of documentation you can keep for a project and I spoke about the three purposes of a data dictionary. One of those purposes being that they can be used in your data cleaning process. And when I say “used”, I mean that in both a non-literal sense (for example I can refer to my data dictionary for guidance as to what transformations my data might need), but I also meant it in a very literal sense.
